Questions.question: Tell me about yourself?
Questions.answer: I am a curious and innovative full stack developer.

Questions.question: Walk me through your resume?
Questions.answer: I started my career as a Backend Engineer in a very small called Vida Projects, then I had few gaps when I tried to pursue higher education. Then I joined HCL technologies and continuing here as a Software enginer and I m working here as Technical Lead. I have worked in javascript, jQuery, DOJO, Anguar JS, Angular and React Technologies.

Questions.question: Why do you want to apply for this role?
Do you anticipate any challenges in this role?
Tell me what does a regular day at work look like for you?
Questions.answer: My day will start with checking on the JIRA board for tasks to be completed for me and my team. Then I will start working on the tasks assigned to me and will review and merge the pull requests under my name. Then we have scrum meetings and will discuss on completed tasks and blockers

Questions.question: How would your boss describe your strengths?
Questions.answer: My Boss would tell me as follows...

Questions.question: What are the three qualities your coworkers would say about you?
Why are you looking for a new role?
Questions.answer: To move on to new challenges and to achieve greater heights

Questions.question: How will you work efficiently in a remote working set up?
Questions.answer: I have been working in hybrid remote from 2015 to 2019 and fullly remote for the past six years. So working remotely is not a new experience for me.

Questions.question: What are the challenges you anticipate in a remote working set up?
Questions.answer: Sometimes the network is not working properly, Initally I found this difficult since I got lot of disturbance and I am not able to work in the flow. Now I m abe to overcome the challenges, as I am following a strict routine.

Questions.question: How will you work efficiently in a remote working set up?
Questions.answer: I am following a very strict routine of working 3 (9.30 - 1) + 3 (2 - 5) + 2 ( 7-9) hours. The latter two hours are mostly reserved for meetings and discussions

Questions.question: What motivates you at work?
Questions.answer: Solving new challenges, learning new techonologies, meeting with new people

Questions.question: How do you ensure an effective work life balance?
Questions.answer: By working on strict routines and schedules

Questions.question: If you were an animal, which one would you be?
Do you have any questions for us?
Questions.answer: What is your work routine, communication channels, process adhered

Questions.question: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?
Questions.answer: As a Technical Architect or CTO of a startup

Questions.question: Why should we hire you
Questions.answer: To get your work done in an efficient and effective manner and for luck

Behavioural Questions.question: What do you do when priorities change quickly? Give on example  of a time this happened?
Behavioural Questions.answers: I understand the new priorities and spontaneously respond as  soon as possible. When I was working on CAA project a new security vulnerability came in production which needs to be  addressed quickly, so we fixed the security vulnerability issue  first and then came to the current working task.

Behavioural Questions.question: Describe the project or situation which best demonstrates your analytical abilities. What was your role?
Behavioural Questions.answer: Cisco Prime Collobaration is the project in which I was working  on Analytics Module. This module required a lot of algorithms that needs to be implemented as a huge amount of information  have to be processed based on complex business logics

Behavioural Questions.question: Give me an example of when you took a risk to achieve a goal.  What was the outcome?
Tell us about a time when you built rapport quickly with someone under difficult conditions.
Give me example of a time where your-----
Discuss an important decision you have made regarding a task or  project at work. What factors influenced your decision?
Describe a situation where you felt you had not communicated well. How did you correct the situation?
Tell us about a situation in which you had to adjust to changes  over which you had no control. How did you handle it?
Give an example of an important goal that you set in the past.  Tell about your success in reaching it.
Tell us about a time when you were particularly effective on  prioritizing tasks and completing a project on schedule.
Tell us how you keep your job knowledge current with the ongoing  changes in the industry.
When you disagree with your manager, what do you do? Give an example

It is very important to build good relationships at work but sometimes it doesnâ€™t always work. If you can, tell about a time when you were not able to build a successful relationship with a  difficult person
Describe a situation when you were able to strengthen a  relationship by communicating effectively. What made your communication effective?
Give me an example of a time when you were able to successfully  communicate with another person, even when that individual may not have personally liked you.
How do you keep your manager informed about what is being done in your work area?
Tell us about a time when you and your current/previous supervisor disagreed but you still found a way to get your point across
Everyone has made some poor decisions or has done something that just did not turn out right. Has this happened to you? What happened?
Do prefer to work with the 'big picture' or the 'details' of a situation? Give me an example of an experience that illustrates  your preference
Describe a situation when you demonstrated initiative and took action without waiting for direction. What was the outcome?
What time in PST are you comfortable working at?
If we were to give you an offer, when can you join?
What is your approach when you are trying to learn something new?
Can you tell me about a time when you introduced something new to the team?
How much money do you want to make?
Do you want to work from home, from an office or from anywhere? - any where
Would you prefer to work in a multinational, in a startup, a  family business or having your own company?
Which kind of tasks would you enjoy doing?
